name: Park Lane Motel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: room was very clean and comfortable with refrigerater in room. lots of clean towels with nice soap and shampoo. waterfront is beautiful and we enjoy wathing the boats. pool is very clea. the best part is the wonderful staff and Dave the owner. we walk to restaurants shops the the park. we hope to return severel times this summer and fall.
reviews.title: return visit to park lane on lake george

reviews.text: This is a very good motel, but for Lake George it is excellent. I have not been overly impressed with the lodging choices in Lake George but the Park Lane was clean, comfortable, and walking distance to the whole village. It is obvious the owner really takes pride in his property and the staff is very nice as well. Everyone from the receptionist to the room attendants were friendly and always asked if there was anything I wanted. Like most of the motels in this area it is old but very well maintained and spotless. The room was small but that was the way they were built. However it looked like it had been recently painted and was very comfortable. There were tables and chairs on the balcony so I could visit with my neighbors which is something that has been lost in the newer hotels. The price was reasonable for Americade motorcycle rally week so this may be my go to place for lodging whenever I visit Lake George.
reviews.title: A very good motel stay

reviews.text: Just want you to know my family and I spend a good part of our summer in Lake George and we stay at Park Lane Motel. We start Memorial Day and go thru Labor Day. Let me tell you I have seen many events and everything was great. Our stay at Park Lane was great as usual. The rooms were very clean the staff were very friendly and if you needed something, they got it. Which is really nice the owners live on the property. We go about 10 times in the summer and for the car show and the motor cycle show Dave and Erin have a barbecue for the entire motel. Its really a great place to stay. We love it and I think you would too. its family business.
reviews.title: Summer Getaway

reviews.text: -The Latko Family
reviews.title: Fun Family Motel

reviews.text: My Family and I had a delightful stay at the Park Lane Motel during the last week of August.
reviews.title: Beautiful Lake George

reviews.text: Free kayaks, Lake front, beach, deck over looking lake, walk to town, clean pool with BBQ grills. Small hotel but with great perks and owner on premises. Kids love it and I can sit back relax by pool or lake with some cold ones. No need to drive can walk anywhere. Very friendly people staying here. 3rd year here gets better every time.
reviews.title: Great family vacation spot

reviews.text: My wife and I brought our 4 yr old daughter here for the second time in 3 yrs. Lots of little extras that they do for you here like kayaks to use on the lake, board games for those rainy nights and seating area set up for the Thursday night fireworks with popcorn and sno-cones. Definitely won't be our last time coming here.
reviews.title: Another nice stay.

reviews.text: Stayed at Park Lane 7/7 & 7/8/13. Some of their rooms have been upgraded and are wonderful. Beautiful bedding and the most comfortable mattress. They now have much bigger refrigerators which are wonderful. I have to eat gluten free and there is plenty of room for the GF food/snacks that I bring. Also a great sized freezer. The owners/workers are the most friendly and helpful. The motel is right on the lake and the pool is WARM, yeah!! Great friendly guests. It is very important to me that I feel safe at a motel, and I do at Park Lane. Will continue coming back . I traveled with a friend and we are already planning the next trip!
reviews.title: Third Time Even Better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second time staying at the Park Lane Motel in Lake George. Decided to go to Lake George as a last minute getaway and my first call was to the Park Lane.
reviews.title: Great location and value
Great place at an excellent price!
reviews.text: The Park Lane is an older motel as pretty much all of the motels on Canada St are, but the owners are always doing work to improve and maintain the property, which after staying at another motel close by a few years back made me realize that isn't the case with all of the properties nearby.
The room was clean, beds were comfortable, and views were amazing.
reviews.title: Lovely views of the lake, close to town

reviews.text: We got off to a bumpy start, the toilet made a noise that my three year olds called a jack-hammer. We called the desk and 6 hours later it still hadn't been addressed. Had to be persistent (we were worried it would gyrate off the wall!), and finally around 9 p.m. it was fixed.
reviews.title: Nice location and good hosts

reviews.text: That said, the view for the fireworks was unmatched, and they really brought out amenities to watch - popcorn and sno cones and chairs facing the lake.
reviews.title: Clean, renovated with ideal location.

reviews.text: Stayed for our second time at the Park Lane. While we had a few issues at the outset, they were quickly and efficiently addressed. The location is excellent, and easily walkable to all the Village events and areas. Rooms also had many amenities that we appreciated, like a refrigerator that really worked, flat screen TV, DVD player (great for our toddler), microwave and more. We had a beautiful view of the lake from our bistro, which was good since we could be close by the room sipping drinks while our little one slept. The owner put out chairs, and provided popcorn and snow cones for the fireworks on Thursday night, which was a nice touch. We didn't get a chance to use the pool or kayaks (weather was a bit cold/wet), but these are nice amenities as well. The large heated pool sets them apart from many of their neighbors. Beach is small, but they all are for these waterfront motels. Small, but very nice playground was also there, which suited our toddler very well.
reviews.title: Great motel

reviews.text: We went to Lake George for 3 days and stayed here. The rooms are very good for a motel and newly renovated with new tv's. clean and right next to boardwalk. The pool is nice and warm and big. The beach area is a little small. Definitely a good place to stay.
reviews.title: Perfect!!

reviews.text: I wasn't planning to stay in Lake George, but something told me to get off of the NY State Thruway and see the back country of this beautiful part of NY state. The drive south, along U.S. Rt. 9W was dramatically beautiful. I saw topography up close and personal, that you just don't see while cruising down the U.S. interstate system. Coming into Lake George, I was astounded by the number of hotels, motels, cozy cabins, and the associated tourist places, souvernir stores, drive-ins, restaurants, etc.
reviews.title: Happy Accident in Lake George!

reviews.text: I did a quick look at TripAdvisor and selected three places to check out, given their high marks. Park Lane wasn't my first choice, but it should have been. Located right on Lake George, in an otherwise very busy part of the main village, it nonetheless exuded old world (back to the 50's) charm and quiet. The guests there were diverse, from Quebec visitors from the north, to families in minivans, to Harley-riding dudes and dudettes, to well, a nice mix of tourists!
reviews.title: Great Location, Affordable and Excellent Service

reviews.text: The owner, David, offered me two rooms, the 2nd of which he said I was going to prefer, and he was right! On the 3rd floor, closest to the lake, so it wouldn't have small children running around above me, with a great view of the lake from my table and chairs outside the room. Basic, clean comfort inside. And a lake right there, in which I swam both at night and early in the morning!
reviews.title: fun in the sun

reviews.text: Ice machine offered vast amounts of ice, which I quickly filled my bucket with. The room a/c was quiet, although not needed during my stay, as the temps were perfect for leaving open my window. The pool shut down nicely at 10pm, and all became peaceful and quiet. HEAVEN!
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.text: David recommended several places for dinner, but ultimately, I chose an Indian restaurant, located within walking distance. Everything in Lake George appears to be geared toward the happy tourist, and it delivered at the Park Lane in spades.
reviews.title: OK But Not As Great As I Thought It Would Be

description: On the lake in the Heart of Lake George Village offering reasonable rates. Within walking distance shops, restaurants and attractions. Enjoy our lakefront and poolside patios with free gas grills, beach area with free use of kayaks, 60-foot heated pool, playground area, free DVD movies and board games.We have well appointed modern rooms with 32-inch flat panel televisions, refrigerators, microwaves, coffee makers, hair dryers, irons, heat and air conditioning.
